Dear Ms. Leapheart:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
10/16/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less than
60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
One of the three current foster home files reviewed indicated the foster parents were
not given an application for the renewal of the foster home license at least 60
calendar days before the expiration date of the license. In this example the
documentation indicates the foster parents received the application 04/27/2020 and
the license had an expiration date of 05/18/2020.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the
reevaluation. The placement specifications shall include all
of the following:
(a) Age,
(b) Gender,
(c) Race,
(d) Number of children preferred by the family,
(e) Characteristics of children best served by the home,
(f) Children who may not be placed in the home. The
child's racial, ethnic, and cultural identity, heritage, and
background may only be considered if an assessment of
the individual child indicates that such consideration is in
the best interests of the child.
Two of the three current foster home files reviewed did not have all the information in
the recommendations as required by this rule. In the first example the
corresponding 3706 indicated an acceptable gender of male or female, but an
acceptable gender was not identified in the recommendations in a report dated
05/17/2020. In the second example the 3706 identified a capacity of 3 and age
range of 8-16 years and the corresponding report recommendations did not identify
a capacity and the age range was for 10-18 years.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
4

Two of the three current foster home files reviewed indicated a licensing
recommendation was not made for the renewal of the license at least 15 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. In the first example the
recommendation was made 06/04/2020 for a license with an expiration date of
05/18/2020. In the second example the recommendations was made 07/01/2020 for
a license with an expiration date of 07/01/2020. This is a repeat violation from the
interim evaluation completed 12/17/2019.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
One of the six current foster child records reviewed contained an updated service
plan that was completed outside the time frame established by this rule. In this
example the report period ended 08/17/2020 and the corresponding report was
completed 08/20/2020.
R 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time.
An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation and parenting
time that contains, at a minimum, all of the following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the foster child
and the foster parent in the foster parent's home at least once
every month.
Three of the six foster child records reviewed indicated the social service worker did
not visit the foster child in the foster parent home at least once every month. In all
three examples the month of November 2019 did not have a documented foster
home visit.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which
will be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
Some information was not able to be located in the MISACWIS system as a part of this
renewal evaluation. Some examples of the information that could not be located was
one foster home application, some information related to the renewal of a foster home
license, two updated service plans, one parent agency treatment plan and
documentation of an FTM. This is a repeat violation from the interim evaluation
completed 12/17/2019.

EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted an acceptable corrective action plan for the interim evaluation
completed 12/17/2019. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review
were R 400.12212 (3)(a), R 400.12324 (8), R 400.12326 (1)(c)(d)((h), R 400.12413
(1)(c)(iii) (f)(i), and ISEP 4.22 MISACWIS. The only areas identified as repeat
noncompliance as a part of this renewal evaluation are R 400.12324 (8), and ISEP
4.22 MISACWIS.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of
an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
